metadata.name: Allow Service Access Using Security Descriptor Tampering Via Sc.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects suspicious DACL modifications to allow access to a service from a suspicious trustee. This can be used to override access restrictions set by previous ACLs.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\sc.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('sc.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('sdset')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('a;')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(';iu')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(';su')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(';ba')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(';sy')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(';wd'))))

output.summary: Detects suspicious DACL modifications to allow access to a service from a suspicious trustee. This can be used to override access restrictions set by previous ACLs.
